intro: Sagraea glomerata, commonly known as the clustered sagraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are strap-shaped and often remain evergreen throughout the year. Sagraea glomerata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
